questions.question: There are 42 Laws of Cricket as defined by the MCC.
A cricket ball must weigh between 155.9 and 163 grams.
The cricket pitch is exactly 22 yards long.
A batsman can be given out 'Handled the Ball' under the current laws.
The stumps must be 28 inches high.
A wide ball cannot result in a wicket being taken.
The boundary must be at least 65 yards from the center of the pitch.
A no-ball results in one run being added to the batting team's total.
The Laws of Cricket are updated every 10 years.
A batsman can be run out while the ball is 'dead'.
